lexUnit.name: suppose.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: think or assume that something is true or probable, but without proof.

sentence.text: I suppose people prefer to wait until most of the audience has gone .
Suppose the government imposes a profits tax on a monopolist : what effect would this have on the monopolist 's output decision ?
I suppose a woman speaking out on this issue might appear slightly inelegant .
I suppose they get on reasonably well , but they do tend to rub each other up .
` I suppose you 'd rather I was clothed in a voluminous sack ; then your beloved Dane would n't be able to ogle my body as he normally does . "
I suppose you 're frightened of me messing it all up for you , with my dirty boots and all that … . ’
Nicholas supposed honour was partially satisfied .
He supposed he 'd been lucky , considering .
I suppose it 's natural .
I do n't suppose it 's too late anyway .
Charity supposed that there could be at least an element of truth in that , though she did not feel comforted .
It would be very naive to suppose that one report taken on its own could tell you as much as you might want to know about the organization .
Let us suppose that there are characteristic feelings associated with trumping and revoking .
Their administrators had too readily supposed that the pleasure of kicking a ball across a stretch of grass was an acceptable substitute for the real danger and excitement of a raid .
Ca n't we at least suppose that others have the same experience ? "
I suppose he thought I did n't know the different you see .
` Then I suppose I 'll have to go up there and find out . "
No-one supposed we might be talking about the possible next leader of ` The Free World " .
Similarly , suppose one starts with two boxes , one containing oxygen molecules and the other containing nitrogen molecules .
There is no reason to suppose that care in other branches of medicine has been more thoroughly validated , so Smith is setting the GMC an impossibly large task .
Scientists found themselves able to explain how one event causes another in the physical world without supposing objects in that world to have all the qualities we perceive them as having .
Now I suppose I shall have to tramp back to Moorgate underground station , before I can find a cab .
` And I suppose you 're a big grown-up girl now ? "
Now suppose we have a change in the tectonic situation , resulting , perhaps , from the stable situation reached in the near-shore area .
` Suppose so , " said Fagg .
` Other people would call it treacherous , I suppose .
Bill was completely subversive and that , I suppose , is why he liked climbing and why he endeared himself to climbers .
I suppose the whole thing is not a vision and a touch of nerves ? "
